description: Implement clean, human-readable event URLs at /e/{slug} so events are easily shareable and brandable. This covers slug generation during event creation, routing to the public event page via slug, and handling invalid or duplicate slugs gracefully.

userStories.title: Auto-generate a URL slug when creating an event
userStories.description: As an event host, I want a URL-friendly slug to be automatically generated from my event title when I create an event, so that my event has a clean, shareable URL without extra effort.
acceptanceCriteria: When an event is created via the API route in src/app/api/events/, a slug is generated from the event title (lowercased, spaces replaced with hyphens, special characters stripped)
If a generated slug already exists in the database, a short numeric or random suffix is appended to ensure uniqueness
The slug is stored in the events table and returned in the API response
The slug column has a unique constraint in the database
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/event-creation.spec.ts verifies that a created event has a valid slug in the response

userStories.title: Resolve public event page by slug
userStories.description: As a guest, I want to visit shindig.app/e/{slug} and see the correct event page, so that I can view event details from a clean, memorable URL.
acceptanceCriteria: The dynamic route at src/app/e/[slug]/page.tsx fetches the event by slug from Supabase instead of by ID
If the slug matches an existing event, the full public event page renders with all event details (title, date, description, cover image, location, gifts, calendar link)
If the slug does not match any event, a 404 page or 'Event not found' message is displayed
Existing links and references to event pages throughout the app use the slug-based URL
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/public-event.spec.ts verifies navigating to /e/{slug} renders the correct event

userStories.title: Allow hosts to customize the event slug
userStories.description: As an event host, I want to optionally set a custom slug for my event during creation, so that I can choose a memorable, branded URL for my event.
acceptanceCriteria: The event creation form in src/app/create/page.tsx includes an optional 'Custom URL' input field that shows a preview like shindig.app/e/{slug}
If the host provides a custom slug, it is validated (lowercase, alphanumeric and hyphens only, 3-60 characters) and checked for uniqueness via an API call
If the custom slug is already taken, the user sees an inline error message before submitting
If no custom slug is provided, the auto-generated slug from US-001 is used
The API route in src/app/api/events/ accepts an optional slug field and validates it server-side
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/event-creation.spec.ts verifies that a custom slug can be set and the event is accessible at that slug

userStories.title: Redirect old or alternate event URLs to the canonical slug URL
userStories.description: As a guest, I want to be redirected to the correct event page if I visit an outdated or ID-based event URL, so that I always land on the right page and bookmarks stay valid.
acceptanceCriteria: If an event is accessed via its database ID at /e/{id}, the server redirects (HTTP 301) to /e/{slug}
The redirect is handled in src/app/e/[slug]/page.tsx by detecting whether the parameter is a UUID vs a slug
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/public-event.spec.ts verifies that visiting /e/{event-id} redirects to /e/{slug}
